title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. — On a night where history was written in the box score, Alonzo Mourning delivered a performance for the ages, single-handedly dismantling the Charlotte Hornets and carrying the Miami Heat to a decisive 101-86 road victory in 1997.

Mourning was not merely a participant; he was an unstoppable force of nature. The stat line reads like a typo: a colossal **42 points** on 15-of-24 shooting, a staggering **15 rebounds**, and an intimidating **9 blocked shots**. From the opening tip, he established a dominance so complete that the Hornets had no answer. Every entry into the paint was met with the threat of one of his nine rejections, turning the lane into his personal fortress.

While Tim Hardaway provided crucial support with 14 points and 7 assists, and Voshon Lenard added 13 points, this night belonged unequivocally to Mourning. His offensive repertoire was as diverse as it was efficient, scoring at will from the post and drawing fouls, converting 12 of his 16 free throws.

The Hornets, led by Glen Rice's 22 points, simply could not match the intensity generated by Miami's centerpiece. Mourning’s near-triple-double, missing a tenth block by a single swat, underscored a two-way performance so dominant it felt like a man against boys. This was more than a win; it was a statement, a 48-minute showcase of individual brilliance that cemented Alonzo Mourning’s place among the league’s most formidable big men.
